text: Mix mashed potato flakes, powdered milk, salt, boiling water, and margarine or butter.  Chill thoroughly. Even better, refrigerate overnight. Add the 3 cups flour and mix.  Flour the board. Roll the mixture into a long tube and cut into about 36 pieces. Add more flour to the board. Roll each piece into a ball, put into a bowl, and keep the bowl in refrigerator. Take out one ball at a time. Roll with rolling pin into a very thin tortilla-like circle. Bake on a preheated griddle (at about 400-450 degrees) on one side until brown spots appear.  Flip over. Bake other side until browned. Remove from griddle. Butter and sprinkle sugar over lefse and roll into a tube.  Fold one end up. This is to keep butter from dripping out. Store cooked lefse between 2 towels to keep fresh. This is if you are making lefse faster than they can be consumed. Finished.
